question.text: Sickle-cell anemia trait is an adaptation against malaria. It is due to substitution (point mutation) in which

options.text: instead of an acidic amino acid valine, a neutral amino acid valine comes at the number 6<sup>th</sup> position in one of the <math><mi mathvariant="normal">β-</mi></math>chain of Hb
instead of neutral amino acid valine, acidic amino acid glutamic acid is inserted at the number 6<sup>th</sup> position of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">β</mi></math> chain Hb
instead of neutral amino acid glutamic acid, an acidic amino acid valine comes at 6<sup>th</sup> position in one of the β-chain of Hb
instead of an acidic amino acid glutamic acid, a neutral amino acid valine comes at 6<sup>th</sup> position in one of the β-chain of Hb

solution.text: Sickle-cell anemia is a qualitative blood disorder, which is controlled by the recessive autosomal gene. In this change in single nucleotide in DNA sequence results in change in 6<sup>th</sup> amino acid of β-chain of Hb.
